required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Insulin Detemir and Insulin Aspart in 2 Separate Injections Twice Daily to Extemporaneous Mixing Injection Regimen Twice Daily - The Paediatric Mixing Trial
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Multicentric, Open Labelled, Parallel Group Trial With Insulin Aspart and Insulin Detemir, Investigating the Glycaemic Effect and Profile in Children With Type 1 Diabetes, of Two Separate Levemir® + NovoRapid® Injections and Extemporaneous Mixing - The Paediatric MIXING Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is conducted in Europe. The aim of the trial is to compare two methods of injection in basal-bolus insulin regimen in children with type 1 diabetes with insulin detemir associated with insulin aspart given twice daily in either separate or mixed injections and to investigate if there is any clinical impact in choosing one regimen over another.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weight Z Score
secondary_outcome.description: Z score of weight. To estimate the growth of children, standardised mean weight values were calculated for each month of age and for each sex

secondary_outcome.measure: Body Mass Index (BMI) Z Score
secondary_outcome.description: Z score of BMI index. To estimate the growth of children, standardised mean BMI values were calculated for each month of age and for each sex

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Hypoglycaemic Episodes - All Episodes
secondary_outcome.description: Number of hypoglycaemic episodes from Week 0 to Week 8, defined as self-measurement plasma glucose less than 56 mg/dL (3.1 mmol/L). Classified as major, minor or symptoms only. Major if unable to treat her/himself (given the age of the study population, the definition of major hypoglycemia was to be adapted through the investigator's judgment). Minor if able to treat her/himself and plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL). Symptoms only if able to treat her/himself and no plasma glucose measurement or plasma glucose higher than or equal to 3.1 mmol/L.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Hypoglycaemic Episodes - Glycaemia Below 0.56 g/L
secondary_outcome.description: Number of minor hypoglycaemic episodes from Week 0 to Week 8, defined as self-measurement plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL) and the child is able to treat her/himself.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Hypoglycaemic Episodes - Glycaemia Above or Equal to 0.56 g/L
secondary_outcome.description: Number of "symptoms only" hypoglycaemic episodes from Week 0 to Week 8, defined as self-measurement plasma glucose higher than or equal to 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL) or no plasma glucose measurement and the child is able to treat her/himself.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Children Assessing Insulin Therapy Injection Pain as "Sad Face"
secondary_outcome.description: Via a paper diary, the children perceived insulin therapy injection pain by using a four-grade facial visual analogue scale (VAS): very sad face, sad face, happy face or very happy face.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Children Assessing Insulin Therapy Injection Pain as "Happy Face"
secondary_outcome.description: Via a paper diary, the children perceived insulin therapy injection pain by using a four-grade facial visual analogue scale (VAS): very sad face, sad face, happy face or very happy face.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Children Assessing Insulin Therapy Injection Pain as "Very Happy Face"
secondary_outcome.description: Via a paper diary, the children perceived insulin therapy injection pain by using a four-grade facial visual analogue scale (VAS): very sad face, sad face, happy face or very happy face.

intervention.description: Treat-to-target (individually adjusted) dose titration, s.c. (under the skin) injection, twice a day, mixed with insulin aspart
Treat-to-target (individually adjusted) dose titration, s.c. (under the skin) injection, twice a day, mixed with insulin detemir
Treat-to-target (individually adjusted) dose titration, s.c. (under the skin) injection, twice a day, injected separately with insulin aspart
Treat-to-target (individually adjusted) dose titration, s.c. (under the skin) injection, twice a day, injected separately with insulin detemir

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Parents' Informed Consent (IC) obtained before any trial-related activities
- Obtained child's assent (when possible)
- Type 1 diabetes
- Treatment with insulin detemir and insulin aspart either in extemporaneous mixed or separate injections
- HbA1c (glycosylated haemoglobin A1c) lesser than or equal to 8.6%
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of alcoholism, drug abuse, or psychiatric disease or personality disorders likely to invalidate voluntary consent or to prevent good compliance with the trial protocol
- Mental incapacity, unwillingness or language barrier precluding adequate understanding or co-operation
- Anticipated change or new use in concomitant medication known to interfere with glucose metabolism, such as systemic corticotherapy more than 5 mg/day (prednisone)
- Any other condition that the Investigator (trial physician) feels would interfere with trial participation or evaluation of results

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Insulin degludec, insulin aspart drug combination

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Children with type 1 diabetes currently treated with insulin detemir and insulin aspart and with a good glycaemic control. At trial entry, subjects must be 6-18 years old with a HbA1c (glycosylated haemoglobin) below or equal to 8.6%

group.title: Mixed Injection
group.description: Individually adjusted insulin detemir extemporaneous mixed with individually adjusted insulin aspart injected s.c. twice daily (in the morning and in the evening) + extra insulin aspart at lunch and breaks, if needed

group.title: Separate Injection
group.description: Individually adjusted insulin detemir and individually adjusted insulin aspart injected separately s.c. twice daily (in the morning and in the evening) + extra insulin aspart at lunch and breaks, if needed

participants_list.participants: One subject randomly assigned to receive mixed injections, but received a separate injection mode
One subject randomly assigned to receive mixed injections, but received a separate injection mode

group.title: Mixed Injection
group.description: Individually adjusted insulin detemir extemporaneous mixed with individually adjusted insulin aspart injected s.c. twice daily (in the morning and in the evening) + extra insulin aspart at lunch and breaks, if needed

group.title: Separate Injection

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Diabetes history
measure.description: Number of years since diagnosis

outcome.title: Glycosylated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
outcome.description: Measured for the Per Protocol (PP) set
outcome.population: Per Protocol (PP) analysis set consists of all the ITT (Intention-to-Treat) subjects who did not present any significant protocol deviations that could potentially affect the efficacy results. One subject was excluded from PP as subject received separate injections despite being randomised to receive mixed injections.

group.title: Mixed Injection
group.description: Individually adjusted insulin detemir extemporaneous mixed with individually adjusted insulin aspart injected s.c. twice daily (in the morning and in the evening) + extra insulin aspart at lunch and breaks, if needed

group.title: Separate Injection
group.description: Individually adjusted insulin detemir and individually adjusted insulin aspart injected separately s.c. twice daily (in the morning and in the evening) + extra insulin aspart at lunch and breaks, if needed

measure.title: Glycosylated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
measure.description: Measured for the Per Protocol (PP) set
measure.population: Per Protocol (PP) analysis set consists of all the ITT (Intention-to-Treat) subjects who did not present any significant protocol deviations that could potentially affect the efficacy results. One subject was excluded from PP as subject received separate injections despite being randomised to receive mixed injections.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was considered confirmed if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% confidence interval was below or equal to 0.25% or equivalently if the p-value for the one-sided test of H0: D>0.25% against HA: D=<0.25%, was less than or equal to 2.5%, where D is the mean treatment difference (mixing injections minus separate injections).
analysis.p_value_desc: If non-inferiority was confirmed, the superiority of the mixed injection group over separate injection group was to be investigated

outcome.title: Glycosylated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
outcome.description: Measured for the ITT (Intention-to-Treat) set
outcome.population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set consists of all randomised children with a signed informed consent and at least one HbA1c value determined after randomisation. Subjects are analysed based on initial randomisation.

group.title: Mixed Injection

group.title: Separate Injection

measure.population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set consists of all randomised children with a signed informed consent and at least one HbA1c value determined after randomisation. Subjects are analysed based on initial randomisation.

analysis.p_value_desc: If non-inferiority was confirmed, the superiority of the mixed injection group over separate injection group was to be investigated.

measure.title: Pharmacokinetics: Tmax of Insulin Detemir
measure.description: The observed peak drug concentration at time (T): T0, T0.5hour (hr), T1hr, T1.5hr, T2hrs, T2.5hrs, T3hrs, T3.5hrs, T4hrs
measure.population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set consists of all randomised children with a signed informed consent and at least one HbA1c value determined after randomisation. Subjects are analysed based on initial randomisation.

outcome.title: Weight Z Score
outcome.description: Z score of weight. To estimate the growth of children, standardised mean weight values were calculated for each month of age and for each sex
outcome.population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set consists of all randomised children with a signed informed consent and at least one HbA1c value determined after randomisation. Subjects are analysed based on initial randomisation.

outcome.title: Incidence of Hypoglycaemic Episodes - All Episodes
outcome.description: Number of hypoglycaemic episodes from Week 0 to Week 8, defined as self-measurement plasma glucose less than 56 mg/dL (3.1 mmol/L). Classified as major, minor or symptoms only. Major if unable to treat her/himself (given the age of the study population, the definition of major hypoglycemia was to be adapted through the investigator’s judgment). Minor if able to treat her/himself and plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL). Symptoms only if able to treat her/himself and no plasma glucose measurement or plasma glucose higher than or equal to 3.1 mmol/L.
outcome.population: All randomised subjects who received at least one treatment dose are taken into account in the safety analysis set. Subjects are analysed based on treatments actually received.

group.title: Mixed Injection
group.description: Individually adjusted insulin detemir extemporaneous mixed with individually adjusted insulin aspart injected s.c. twice daily (in the morning and in the evening) + extra insulin aspart at lunch and breaks, if needed

group.title: Separate Injection
group.description: Individually adjusted insulin detemir and individually adjusted insulin aspart injected separately s.c. twice daily (in the morning and in the evening) + extra insulin aspart at lunch and breaks, if needed

measure.title: Incidence of Hypoglycaemic Episodes - All Episodes
measure.description: Number of hypoglycaemic episodes from Week 0 to Week 8, defined as self-measurement plasma glucose less than 56 mg/dL (3.1 mmol/L). Classified as major, minor or symptoms only. Major if unable to treat her/himself (given the age of the study population, the definition of major hypoglycemia was to be adapted through the investigator’s judgment). Minor if able to treat her/himself and plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL). Symptoms only if able to treat her/himself and no plasma glucose measurement or plasma glucose higher than or equal to 3.1 mmol/L.
measure.population: All randomised subjects who received at least one treatment dose are taken into account in the safety analysis set. Subjects are analysed based on treatments actually received.

outcome.title: Incidence of Hypoglycaemic Episodes - Glycaemia Below 0.56 g/L
outcome.description: Number of minor hypoglycaemic episodes from Week 0 to Week 8, defined as self-measurement plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL) and the child is able to treat her/himself.
outcome.population: All randomised subjects who received at least one treatment dose are taken into account in the safety analysis set. Subjects are analysed based on treatments actually received.

group.title: Mixed Injection
group.description: Individually adjusted insulin detemir extemporaneous mixed with individually adjusted insulin aspart injected s.c. twice daily (in the morning and in the evening) + extra insulin aspart at lunch and breaks, if needed

group.title: Separate Injection
group.description: Individually adjusted insulin detemir and individually adjusted insulin aspart injected separately s.c. twice daily (in the morning and in the evening) + extra insulin aspart at lunch and breaks, if needed

measure.title: Incidence of Hypoglycaemic Episodes - Glycaemia Below 0.56 g/L
measure.description: Number of minor hypoglycaemic episodes from Week 0 to Week 8, defined as self-measurement plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL) and the child is able to treat her/himself.
measure.population: All randomised subjects who received at least one treatment dose are taken into account in the safety analysis set. Subjects are analysed based on treatments actually received.

class.title: W/o info on presence of symptoms

outcome.title: Incidence of Hypoglycaemic Episodes - Glycaemia Above or Equal to 0.56 g/L
outcome.description: Number of “symptoms only” hypoglycaemic episodes from Week 0 to Week 8, defined as self-measurement plasma glucose higher than or equal to 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL) or no plasma glucose measurement and the child is able to treat her/himself.
outcome.population: All randomised subjects who received at least one treatment dose are taken into account in the safety analysis set. Subjects are analysed based on treatments actually received.

measure.population: All randomised subjects who received at least one treatment dose are taken into account in the safety analysis set. Subjects are analysed based on treatments actually received.

class.title: W/o information on presence of symptoms

outcome.title: Percentage of Children Assessing Insulin Therapy Injection Pain as "Sad Face"
outcome.description: Via a paper diary, the children perceived insulin therapy injection pain by using a four-grade facial visual analogue scale (VAS): very sad face, sad face, happy face or very happy face.
outcome.population: All randomised subjects who received at least one treatment dose are taken into account in the safety analysis set. Subjects are analysed based on treatments actually received.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Steering Committee has the right to publish the entire results of the trial. Any such scientific paper, presentation, communication, or other information concerning the investigation must be approved by the Steering Committee, and copies submitted in writing to Novo Nordisk prior to submission for publication/presentation for comments. Comments will be given within four weeks from receipt of the manuscript.
